longdesc.p: The jQuery UI button widget is bundled in jQuery Mobile with some changes. Thus, its API documentation fully describes its functionality.

option.name: corners
option.desc:
Applies the theme button border-radius if set to true.
This option is also exposed as a data attribute: data-corners="false".

option.name: icon
option.desc:
Applies an icon from the icon set.
The .buttonMarkup() documentation contains a reference of all the icons available in the default theme.
This option is also exposed as a data attribute: data-icon="star".

option.name: iconpos
option.desc:
Positions the icon in the . Possible values: left, right, top, bottom, none, notext. The notext value will display an icon-only with no text feedback.
This option is also exposed as a data attribute: data-iconpos="right".

option.name: inline
option.desc:
If set to true, this will make the act like an inline so the width is determined by the 's text. By default, this is null (false) so the is full width, regardless of the feedback content. Possible values: true, false.
This option is also exposed as a data attribute: data-inline="true".

option.name: shadow
option.desc:
Applies the drop shadow style to the if set to true.
This option is also exposed as a data attribute: data-shadow="false".

option.name: wrapperClass
option.desc:
Allows you to specify CSS classes to be set on the 's wrapper element.
This option is also exposed as a data attribute: data-wrapper-class="custom-class".
